availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Timothy Stewart Paul (Kentucky chaplain and soldier)

body.p: Kentucky chaplain and soldier. Tennessee native. Married to Louisa May in Clay County, Kentucky on August 16, 1860. Father of Thomas Paul and Emma Paul. Served in the 7th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as Chaplain from August 15, 1863 to October 5, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Wisconsin, Vernon County, Jefferson, p. 428A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Clay County Marriages, Film #001904623, p. 249 of 678 of microfilm.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 941.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 216.
Find A Grave, "Rev Timothy Stuart Paul (Dec 30, 1835-May 22, 1899)," Memorial #57095019/timothy-stuart-paul, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/57095019/timothy-stuart-paul (accessed August 18, 2020).
